name: tarmac

to cover a surface with Tarmac: The event organisers made an application to tarmac the car parks. They are widening and tarmacking that road.
More examplesFewer examplesDon't park outside on Wednesday because we're going to tarmac the road.She decided to tarmac the path.Work is underway to tarmac the whole valley.

a brand name for a black material used for building roads, etc., that consists of tar mixed with small stones, or an area covered with this material the Tarmac
an area covered in Tarmac, especially the area in an airport where aircraft land and take off

an area of ground covered with a hard surface, esp. the areas of an airport where aircraft park, land, and take off: The plane was damaged on landing when it slid off the tarmac.
